results.title: Summing up
results.creator_credit: Bryan Bruty, Mark Hamlyn and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
Huw Evan presents this final program in the series, in which experts with varying concerns and criticisms about the treatment of psychiatric disorders confront two psychiatrists. Each topic is illustrated by excerpts from the previous programs. Some of the issues discussed are the use of electro-convulsive therapy, treatment with drugs and enforced hospitalisation.

results.title: Putting people away
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
Psychiatrists have the responsibility for deciding who should and who shouldn’t be locked away, whose behaviour is merely eccentric and who is in fact, mentally ill. This program looks at the effect on people’s civil liberties when they are forcibly detained and questions whether it is necessary for the mentally ill to be hospitalised at all.

results.title: Schizophrenia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
The introduction of major psychotic drugs have meant that many schizophrenics can now lead normal lives in the community. These drugs however, can have severe side effects, and sometimes they can only limit the disease. This program looks at some typical case studies in schizophrenia and seeks out opinions on the use of drugs and other methods of treatment of this most frightening illness.

results.title: Depression
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
We all suffer low spirits occasionally, but when depression becomes a devastating illness it can be life threatening. This program looks at the way manic depressives cope with their illness, its causes and at the type of treatment which is available to them.

results.title: Demons and deities
results.creator_credit: John Darling, John McLean and Bozado
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Bali triptych”.
Balinese religion is an amalgam of the worship of local deities and Hindu and Buddhist beliefs. The Balinese display a strong sense of community co-operation and collective responsibility in their adherence to ancestor worship. This is most apparent in the regularity of their attendance at complex rituals at numerous temples and shrines across the island. This program records and explains the significance of many of the most important ceremonies of the 210 day Balinese calendar, ceremonies which feature sacred dance, frenzied trance states and mass exorcism, animal sacrifice, cock fighting, mock battles and time-consuming preparation of elaborate and beautiful decorations and offerings of food.

results.title: The Path of the soul
results.creator_credit: John Darling, John McLean and Bozado
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Bali triptych”.
This second part of a fascinating trilogy on the history, culture and way of life of the people of Bali concentrates on the spiritual beliefs of the Balinese. The Balinese believe in the fundamental unity of all aspects of existence, from birth, to death, to rebirth. Religion is practised as an integral part of daily life and has survived the absorption of Bali into the greater nation of Indonesia and a flood of western tourists. The complex and colourful purification and consecration rites for marriage, pregnancy, birth and death, shown in the video are still practised to maintain the balance between man, nature and the spiritual world and to offer protection from evil spirits.

results.title: Between the mountain and the sea
results.creator_credit: John Daling, John McLean and Bozado
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Bali triptych”.
The first part of a fascinating trilogy on the history, culture and way of life of the people of Bali provides an extensive historical survey of the island. Commencing with the myths and legends of pre-history, the program progresses through the peaceful adoption of Buddhism and then Hinduism by the Balinese, the Javanese conquest of Bali in 1343 which led to an unprecedented flowering of Balinese art and literature, the Dutch annexation of Bali in the mid-19th century which the Balinese met with fierce resistance and mass suicides, the Japanese invasion in 1942 and finally the tourist invasion which still goes on today. The program also covers the Balinese rice industry and the importance of dramatic art in conveying Bali’s history to the Balinese.

results.title: Bad girls. Series two. Discs 3 & 4 [DVD]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Bad girls. Series two”.
The Leaving: (wri. Jayne Hollinson, dir. Mike Adams): Shell’s back on enhanced and is targetting Barbara. Dominic and Zandra are drawn closer through her illness. Denny and Crystal get a new roommate in the young Shaz. “Family plan” (wri. Phil Ford, dir. Mike Adams): Shaz explains to Denny the circumstances of her triple murder charge. Barbara confesses to the attack on Shell. Julie’s trying to have another baby and someone from Yvonne’s past is the latest addtion to the ward. Babes behind bars go under. “Rough justice” (wri. Ann McManus, dir. Mike Adams): Renee’s got it in for everyone and dies under mysterious circumstances. Sylvia is reprimanded over an incident involving Denny and Shaz. Fenner’s having family troubles. “Facing up” (wri. Maureen Chadwick, dir. Laurence Moody): Jim’s mind isn’t on the job, to the detriment of his fellow officers. Nikki’s jealous of Helen and Dominic, Helen has a plan to make Shaz realise the consequence of her actions. “Oh what a night” (wri. Maureen Chadwick, Ann McManus, dir. Laurence Moody): Nikki will do anything to spend one night with Helen on the eve of a party to celebrate Sylvia’s 30 years in the service. Crystal leaves Lark Hall.
